alert.note: Alert for Carter; Coal; Garvin; Hughes; Johnston; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 26 at 10:00PM CST until February 26 at 10:15PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN JOHNSTON...EASTERN GARVIN...NORTHWESTERN COAL... SOUTHERN SEMINOLE...CENTRAL CARTER...PONTOTOC...MURRAY...SOUTHWESTERN HUGHES AND SOUTHEASTERN MCCLAIN COUNTIES... At 959 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Wanette to 5 miles north of Davis to near Milo, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Ardmore, Ada, Pauls Valley, Sulphur, Davis, Lone Grove, Healdton, Wynnewood, Stratford, Byng, Allen, Roff, Springer, Elmore City, Paoli, Ravia, Stonewall, Katie, Mill Creek and Francis. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Carter; Coal; Garvin; Hughes; Johnston; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc; Seminole
